content: matches back finishing on a ws row turn inside out and holding both needle tips in your lh with rs together bind off both left shoulders together using a third needle break yarn and fasten_off turn right side out again shape right front neck with rs facing place centre front 8 sts on a stitch holder or waste yarn and k across 17 18 19 20 21 22 23 25 r front sts next row ws p to last 2sts ssp decrease by 1 st total 16 17 18 19 20 21 22 24 sts next row ssk k to end of row decrease by 1 st total 15 16 17 18 19 20 21 23 sts repeat last 2 row once more decrease by 2 sts total 13 14 15 16 17 18 19 21 sts next row p next row ssk k to end of row decrease by 1 st total 12 13 14 15 16 17 18 20 sts repeat last 2 row 1 2 2 2 2 2 3 3 times more decrease by 1 2 2 2 2 2 3 3 sts total 11 11 12 13 14 15 15 17 sts work straight until right front matches back finishing on a ws row slip sts onto other end of needle so that tips are at outer point of shoulder turn inside out and holding both needle tips in your lh and rs together bind off both right shoulders together using the tail of yarn left from working the back break yarn and fasten_off there will be 20 22 22 22 22 22 24 24 sts neck sts are already on the needle it makes sense to do this now using smaller needle with rs facing and starting at r shoulder k across 20 22 22 22 22 22 24 24 back neck sts puk 13 sts down left front edge k across 8 centre front sts puk 11 sts up right front edge pm for start of round 54 56 56 56 56 56 58 58 sts it doesn t matter if you don t get exactly this number of sts as long as you puk the same number of sts on each side of the neck so that you have an even number of sts in total next round k1 p1 to end of round continue with k1 p1 rib until neckband measures 2 5cm/1 in use your larger needle to cast off loosely in rib if you want to make a funnel or polo neck keep working until your neckband is the desired length page7 of 9 copyright © kate harvie all rights reserved for
